actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-480, by Mr. Goss.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 162.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 82 and H.J. Res. 83 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Bill is closed to amendments.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 385.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 375 - 45 (Roll no. 599).
Mr. Obey moved to reconsider ordering the previous question.
Mr. Goss moved to table the motion to reconsider.
On motion to table the motion to reconsider Agreed to by recorded vote: 316 - 101 (Roll No. 600).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 352 - 63 (Roll no. 601).
Mr. Obey moved to reconsider the vote on agreeing to the resolution.
Mr. Goss moved to table the motion to reconsider.
On motion to table the motion to reconsider Agreed to by recorded vote: 294 - 123 (Roll no. 602).

official_title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 82) making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 2000, and for other purposes, and for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 83) making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 2000, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.J. Res. 82 (continuing appropriations for FY 2000).
